documents.document: @sitharus I'd rephrase that. Antivirus software companies who survived are not those who kept you safe…
@billbennettnz @roddrury since then I've worked with Microsoft, at Samsung, to port CoreCLR to Tizen. I've still not written an app in C#.
@billbennettnz @roddrury as I found when I tried to get a job there: C# or gtfo.
@vaughndavis middle of the night bad weather jaunts to Nelson and Blenheim in the Caravan were fun. DME arc, and twin NDB.
@BCLTax so a kiwi overseas and not currently tax resident can buy a house in NZ without becoming tax resident, if they've never lived in it?
@andyfrecka very popular car with glider pilots. Stable at towing, excellent getting in and out of remote bits of farms with big trailers.
@alicemazzy excellent! There are far too many laws and regulations. It's unnecessary.
@andyfrecka Some is funny here? Hmm? https://t.co/7a8OrvC300
@qwandor sounds excessive. It took 25 hours elapsed from Moscow to Auckland in December.
@EricCrampton buy buy buy! He's not old enough to have a 20% chance of dying.
@billbennettnz was recommended by @brenakiwi
@billbennettnz Milk & Honey? Weird. I was there three weeks ago.
@Kasparov63 isn't 98% of your birth country Muslim?
@billbennettnz I haven't been since soon after Obama became president. No inclination to.
@JohnKasich @Kasparov63 stand up firmly to the individual politicians, but be generous friends to the people suffering under them.
@sigfig did you know before BEL is 7 is ctrl-G is 7th letter is 0x47/0x67? And 10 LF j, 13 CR m etc. Just didn't see the pattern?
@sigfig actually considering Austin when my visa runs out here, as we have an r&d office there and Mountain View is just awful.
@sigfig heh. I was raised on a dairy farm in New Zealand. Now working in *huge* Moscow, with Wellington, Seattle, SF, Chicago between.
@peterrenshaw @paulg we had that possibility too, though I only used it in one course: statistics.. I still have a box of punched cards.
@SiFiveInc @kasanovic @yunsup i.e. output HI and both sides of the LED are at +3.3, so off. Output LO and one side is near GND and other 3.3
@SiFiveInc @kasanovic @yunsup Ahh ... HIFive manual, LED-BUILTIN = 3 = gpio19 = green = wired between gpio 19 and +3.3. So, yes, HI = off
@Rand_Simberg not the aircraft design per se, just every actual instance of it I've been on.
@Rand_Simberg yup. It was designed for 3-3-3, but airlines are all putting in 3-4-3. Much narrower seats than A320&B737, but longer flights.
@Rand_Simberg I've always been a Boeing fan (esp 747), but I loath the 777 (in 3-4-3) whereas the 380 is still comfy on a 17 hour fight.
@Rand_Simberg have you been on an A380?
@SiFiveInc here's one: if you make the times in Blink asymmetrical, you'll find that DigitalWrite(LED_BUILTIN, HIGH) actually turns it off!
@SiFiveInc @crowd_supply @risc_v as you can see from the photo, I have a backup in case it fails.
@SiFiveInc I'm sure I will. Btw, who does the tweeting there?
@BongVentures @POTUS @AndrewOrlowski I worry dilution of oxegens causes poor brain function where there are high millennial concentrations.
@BongVentures @POTUS @AndrewOrlowski I'm quite concerned that this poison with two dioxides has reached 400 percent per millennial.
@SiFiveInc @crowd_supply @risc_v HiFive1 finally arrived in Moscow, just in time to play in the weekend :-) https://t.co/FREdjC90MW
@actparty @mfyfyr but the real question is did Voltaire like the coq?
@majicDave moar surfing pics, dude! I can swap you some photos of snow. It was -24 here yesterday morning.
It's still a stupid idea, but it's a lot cheaper than many stupid ideas.
In reality, a 1% tariff would be more than enough. $10 per US citizen per year.
The cost of a wall is estimated at $25b — so what are they going to do with all the money after the first 4 months? Or 6, if trade drops.
@ProjectLRNJ besides which, the entire cost of a wall is likely about four months of such a tariff.
@ProjectLRNJ of course. That's the maximum possible impact. Utterly trivial compared to, say, ACA.
USA imported $316b from Mexico in 2015. A 20% tariff would be $63b, or $200 per person.
@StephenFleming Gulfstream G650 $65m, B737/A320 $80m-$90m, super Hornet $100m. Got to be at the low end of those.
@Kasparov63 one is to keep people out, the other was to keep people in. Minor but vital difference.
@nzkoz forget Americans, kiwis are blocking me for saying Trump is bad but not actually the end of the world. (And better than HRC)
@StephenFleming it's a simple plane. Engines are off the shelf, I think (same as e.g. BAE 146). Gun should be doable.
@andreasdotorg I used ATDP and had to lie about the numbers: in NZ pulses=10-digit, not pulses=digit==0?:10:digit as in Germany/USA.
@ajobbins it may be a shocking thought, but having an opinion different to the Democratic Party does not make one automatically wrong.
@ajobbins WAPO, an absolutely "liberal" paper, and even labelled as opinion not news? Opinion is exactly what it is, and I differ.
@ajobbins he's a clown and narcissist, but he's always hired good people, and listens to them (eventually). His picks so far are excellent.
@ajobbins than HRC, yes. Than Obama, I'm not sure yet. Definitely worse than WJC, Reagan, or either of the Bushes.
@ajobbins that's opinion not fact, on which USA is divided 50/50. I dislike Trump intensely, would prefer another, but he's not the devil.
@ajobbins by this definition there is no action a government can take (or reverse) that does not cost lives. It's meaningless.
@ajobbins for example?
@ajobbins because he absolutely should not be using secure systems to connect to social media or normal email. That's an absolute no-no.
@ajobbins the alternative to not having a personal device is to never ever use public web sites, normal email, normal phone for personal use
@ajobbins we don't know yet. We do know that HRC did, was told about it, and didn't give a shit about it.
@asymco you'll never see me decry them! Faster CPUs are great, but i wish they'd keep form factors and especially UIs stable longer.
Nothing wrong using insecure comms, if you're not doing CLASSIFIED things on it. Posting to twitter SHOULD be isola… https://t.co/5M6iIXFdOS
@asymco Apple's ability to maintain ASPs on all their lines, with high replacement loyalty, must be finance story of the century.
@MarkHubbard33 if you can see something in rules that contradicts that I'm dying to know. AFAIK *only* physically being in NZ gains tax R.
@MarkHubbard33 I don't think he spends much time in NZ. As for 'permanent abode', that's relevant for *losing* tax R but I think not gaining
@MarkHubbard33 he's a citizen, not a tax resident.
@Rand_Simberg @quinnnorton we gave him citizenship, so he'll be ok if it gets too hot over there.
@asbradbury @MissPhilbin @Raspberry_Pi we wrote our own "OS" and BCPL code generator (running on VAX) for that thing, as well as design h/w
@asbradbury @MissPhilbin @Raspberry_Pi one of us wanted to use it for music synthesis and scaling was critical. The 68k mul was much slower.
@asbradbury @MissPhilbin @Raspberry_Pi when two friends and I built a wire-wrapped PC in 1983, we chose the 6809 because of fast 8x8->16 mul
@MarkHubbard33 You might just make it after all
I guess that explains why they're not too upset when they hand me a tray and I'm "нет, с собой пожалуйста" and they get a bag and pack it.

Crazy weather. Yesterday was about 0C, now (Wednesday evening) -11, tomorrow morning -24, tomorrow evening -11 again, Friday -2.

@paulg in 1981 I selected my university on the basis they weren't big enough to get a mainframe with punched cards, just a PDP11 with VT52s.
@nzkoz Putin made Gulag required reading in schools in October 2010. As far as I know, it hasn't been unmade.
@donkey MkLinux first, then LinuxPPC.Then I got a cheap PC to run Linux so I could keep my Mac as a Mac :-) And then Macs became Unix too.

Very interesting! NZ's Overseas Investment Office says Peter Thiel's recent property purchase doesn't need approval, as he's a NZ citizen!
@donkey Mac at work since 87, home 89. Linux at home on PPC Mac from 96, PentoumPro 98. Still use Mac for most browsing, all audio/video.

@ajobbins I'm troubled by many of his attitudes too, but they were known before the election. Enough people thought Hillary was worse.

Is it safe to look at the sun again yet?
@AndrewOrlowski even the entire instrument temperature record should fit on one DVDR or a small USB flash stick.
@AndrewOrlowski would have also been true before Ford died in Dec 2006 — and one more before Reagan died in 2004.
@keith_ng thanks for the links. I'm relieved to see that the fears of Trump deleting irreplaceable data are groundless.
@keith_ng there weren't. It's an upper bound demonstrating that the amount of data involved is trivial. Comparable to a DVD movie.
